Hello,

Thank you for your email.
It would be benefic if you can start the logs before the issue happens, but as you mentioned that it occurs randomly, we will try to investigate it as it is.
Please see the steps below on how to collect log files from a Windows OS computer:

1. Download the archive to an empty folder at the following link:
 https://download.endpointprotector.com/Support_files/support_tool/SupportTool_win.zip
2. Unzip the sub-archive that corresponds to the operating system of the client computer concerned.
3. Double-click the EPPSupportTool_64 or _32.exe file. This opens a dialog box.
4. Select "Create Append Log Files" and click "Execute". This creates files in the root directory of the C: drive.
5. Right-click the EPP client and click "Update Policies Now".
6. Try to access an internet site (so that the issue is reproduced)
7. Restart the computer (as you mentioned that is the workaround)
8. Right-click the EPP client and click "Update Policies Now".
9. Try to access an internet site (it should work as you mentioned that after the restart, internet browsing is possible)
10. Open EPPSupportTool and click Export Files. This will copy files to the current folder.
11. Send me the created files (archived) so that we can investigate them further.

The IP of the server is 3.6.9.100

Best regards,
Alin Anca
